Q: Best sites to gather cheat-sheets/notes A:

You shouldn't even be considering GeeksForGeeks it has a very low quality, and AFAIK there are no real "C++ cheat sheets". The goto resource for C++ is: https://cppreference.com/ . And another very good resource to ensure you write quality C++ are the C++ core guidelines https://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines. And you should always check other website's advice against the core guidelines because honestly most C++ documentation/examples etc. is either low quality or outdated.

Q: How can I run real cronjobs on Windows for a Laravel application (without using Task Scheduler)? A:

Windows does not have “real cron” – cron is a Unix/Linux service (the crond daemon). On Windows, the native equivalent is Task Scheduler. Laravel itself doesn’t care whether it’s cron or something else; it just needs some scheduler to call. Laravel’s requirement is simply: “run php artisan schedule:run once a minute”. How you schedule that depends entirely on the OS or platform you’re using.

So you have a few options:

1. Use the Windows-native equivalent (Task Scheduler)
On a Windows machine, the “correct” native way is:

  1. Open Task Scheduler.

  2. Create a task that runs php artisan schedule:run every minute.

  3. Set the “Start in” folder to your Laravel project directory so Artisan runs in the right place.

That’s functionally the same role cron plays on Linux.

2. Run real cron via Linux on the same machine
If you literally want cron, you need some form of Linux: WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux) or VM / Docker container

Run your Laravel app inside a Linux VM or container and configure cron inside that environment.

In all of these, you’re no longer relying on Windows for scheduling; you’re relying on Linux running alongside/inside Windows.

3. If you’re using Kubernetes
Since you tagged kubernetes-cronjob: if your app is deployed to Kubernetes, you don’t use Windows Task Scheduler or cron directly at all – you use a Kubernetes CronJob to run the command on a schedule.
